title: About
text: I am Lindsay McMullen! I am from Morton, IL. I am currently a senior sports media & communications major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln graduating in December 2025. I have a Bachelor of Science in Secondary Education and History from Bradley University. ​​​​​​​I have a background in high school education, corporate, sports, and hospitality. I can offer a wide variety of skills through my communication, leadership, attention to detail, and organization.

title: Who is the true volleyball power conference?
text: Big 10 is known to be the power conference of volleyball but are they really?

title: volleyballblog
text:
Who is the true volleyball power conference?

title: Total National Titles over the Power 5 Conferences
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   4.0.0     ✔ tibble    3.3.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors



nc <- read_csv("posts/data/NationalChampionships.csv")

Rows: 5 Columns: 2
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): Conference
dbl (1): Total

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.



head(nc)

# A tibble: 5 × 2
  Conference Total
  <chr>      <dbl>
1 Big 10        11
2 Pac-12        17
3 SEC            2
4 Big 12         8
5 ACC            0



ggplot() + geom_bar(data=nc, aes(x=Conference))









ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=nc, aes(x=Conference, weight= Total))









ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=nc, aes(x=reorder(Conference, Total), weight= Total))









Pac12 <- nc |> 
  filter(
    Conference == "Pac-12"
  )
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=nc, aes(x=reorder(Conference, Total), weight= Total)) + 
  geom_bar(data=Pac12, aes(x=reorder(Conference, Total), weight= Total), fill="blue")   









ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=nc, aes(x=reorder(Conference, Total), weight= Total)) + 
  geom_bar(data=Pac12, aes(x=reorder(Conference, Total), weight= Total), fill="blue") + coord_flip()
